name: The Cape Cadogan

reviews.text: What a lovely hotel to stay at while in Cape Town for four nights! I arrived late in the evening, and had pre-arranged for a meal to be delivered to my room. All arrangements handled promptly and perfectly. I stayed in one of the separate apartments in the block behind the main house. Very nice accomodations - just a short walk to the main house for morning breakfast, which was delicious. Loved eating on the terrace by the small pool. The staff behind the desk were always very helpful to arrange tours for me, dinner reservations, and even provide assistance in securing my packed goods to take home! Location is great - not far from the Mount Nelson Hotel. Nice restaurants nearby. Table Mountain in the background. Will definitely stay only at the Cadogan upon returning to Cape Town!
reviews.title: A charming boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, an excellent stay. The decor of this small hotel is simple, clean, crisp and white. The staff is very helpful - especially the ladies who serve breakfast. And, the breakfast is top notch. The location is very good. The pool is very small, but that was not an issue for us as we were so busy exploring Cape Town. I would go back.
reviews.title: Chic Tiny Hotel in the Heart of Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights in what we belive to be one of the best hotels in Cape Town, The staff were fantasic and the hotel was superb
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: from the smallest little thing to the complementary Sherry or Port at night. We realy cannot recomend this hotel more highly.
reviews.title: A Great Experience

likes.liked: — Great Service. The view of table mountain as you go to breakfast.
likes.disliked: — Only had 3 days to enjoy it

reviews.title: Superb place to stay in Cape Town
reviews.text: Thanks to all .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have recently returned from a six night stay at the Cape Cadogan Hotel in Cape Town. We decided to spend the whole of our short trip in and around Cape Town this time and we were not disappointed. The location of the hotel is excellent for all the "must sees" and it is close to a variety of good restaurants, many within walking distance.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a luxury room, which was a good size with a large balcony and overlooked the plunge pool and courtyard at the side. Only one small suggestion would be to have some more comfortable chairs on the balcony. The shower was huge with two shower heads and good toiletries.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were a treat with a good buffet and a hot selection freshly cooked to order. Everything in and about the Cape Cadogan is beautifully presented and puts many of the large 5*s in the shade! Little details like the willingness to bring tea or coffee at any time and the port, nibbles and chocolates laid out in the lounge every evening make a real difference.
reviews.title: Beware Cape Cadogan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best of all was the delightful staff. Nothing was too much trouble. They arranged trips, taxis, transfers, restaurants very efficiently. Housekeeping was brilliant. All in all we really couldn't fault this hotel and would definitely return. Our friends who live in Cape Town were so impressed that they intend to use the hotel to accommodate overspill visitors too.
reviews.title: Fabulous Place

reviews.text: Thank you to all at the Cape Cadogan for a wonderful trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not that there's anything wrong with this place. It was clean and had functioning air conditioning, and a good bed. The staff, with one exception, Michael, was indifferent. They would answer questions, but in a way that made you feel like you had interrupted them. Our room was at the front of the hotel and the traffic noise from Kloof Street was constantly in the background. An African Villa, just 5 or 6 blocks away, is in every way a superior hotel and it costs about 2/3 of Cape Cadogan's rates.
reviews.title: An ok place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Cape Cadogan in Jan/Feb 2009 and had a fantastic break. Cape Town itself offers a wealth of experiences for the traveller and the weather this time of year is hot, and beautiful. Every day in our week at the Cape was like the best summers day you can expect in the UK, and then some. One day I believe was even as hot as 36 degrees celsius! That was too hot to really go exploring, but if you're happy in the sun, as we are, then it's not an issue. Just a word of warning though, be very liberal with the sun tan lotion! We went for an open top bus tour on our first day and got quite badly burnt! We didn't feel a thing at the time, due to to the cooling wind. We experienced some very strong winds in Cape Town, which are not that uncommon according to the locals.
reviews.title: Had a fabulous time

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel early in the morning, and were given a really friendly welcome. We were helped to our room, room 4, with the luggage, and were left to absorb our surroundings. I think room 4 is great personally. It was bright and airy, and clean. Even if it felt just a little rough around the edges, that simply adds to the charm.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.disliked: — just a plunge pool but as it was not the height of summer it made no difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts at the Cadogan are very nice indeed. You are offered a selection of fresh fruit, pastries and bread, and a cooked breakfast if you fancy it. You can help yourself to water and juices. Although nothing particularly special, the staff are very friendly and attentive, and go out of their way to help. This really adds to the experience, and in some ways puts it leagues ahead of larger 4/5 star hotels. It's definitely a very 'chic' experience.
reviews.title: Great apartment, Incredibly friendly and helpful staff

likes.liked: — Location, friendly/helpful service, newly renovated apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The plunge pool is quite small, and incredibly cold, but that came as a refreshing break in the strength of the sun. If you are out there for long enough you are even offered complimentary drinks/snacks too, which again, is a very nice touch.
reviews.title: We Loved Cape Cadogan

reviews.text: Stayed at the Cape Cadogan for three nights and it was wonderful. Rooms are beautiful and well equipped. Bathroom was huge with big soaking tub and terrific shower. Only complaint I have is that there was no heat in the room so the bathroom was very cold, especially in the early morning. Beds were comfortable and luxurious. The room was very clean. The staff was terrific, so very helpful and always available. The breakfast was superb and our favorite part of the whole stay. Convenient location and nice area. Ocean Basket and Arnold's restaurant are right down the street, both excellent places for dinner or lunch. Lots of other restaurants in the area too.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

likes.liked: — Beautiful, well-appointed rooms and free internet access.

reviews.title: A truly wonderful experience!
reviews.text: After reading the reviews here on TripAdvisor, my husband and I were excited to book a 5 night stay at Cape Cadogan and our experience there was truly wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying in the Owner's Villa. The decor was stunning, the rooms were clean, and the service and attention to detail were impeccable. There is a private pool, a full kitchen, living room, bedroom, and separate bath and shower. Nearly every room was adorned with a fresh bouquet of flowers. It was just lovely and it really did feel like a home away from home.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great; close to all of the major sites and only minutes away from the V&A Waterfront where there is some fantastic dining (be sure to visit Sevruga and have their white chocolate martini--amazing!).
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

likes.liked: — The size, cleanliness and facilities provided

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also be sure to bring warm clothes if you are visiting in the winter as the nights get cold and there is no heating system in the villa.
reviews.title: Terrific Boutique Hotel

description: Offering a rare combination of historic exteriors with classic modern bohemian interiors, it was ‘Victorianised’ in 1912 and declared a National Monument in 1984. Its charm and character is matched with its desirable location amongst the popular restaurants, street cafes and stylish boutique shops of Kloof Street, the heart of Cape Town. More Cape Cadogan is owned and managed by the More Hotels Private Collection.
